component.name: GoTalk Dictation
component.summary: System-wide speech-to-text dictation with global hotkeys

description.p: GoTalk Dictation is inspired by the dictation feature on macOS â€” a global hotkey that lets you speak and have the words typed wherever your cursor is. I built it to scratch my own itch: Linux didn't have anything that just worked the same way. I use it every day, mostly for typing long prompts and messages without touching the keyboard.

Press the hotkey, speak, and the transcribed text appears in whichever app is focused. It uses Google's speech recognition (free, no account needed) and stops automatically when you go silent. A push-to-talk mode is also available if you prefer to hold a key while speaking.
Upgrade to Go 1.26; add release installer script and distro package support.
Initial release with toggle and push-to-talk hotkeys, VAD, 25 languages, Flatpak support, and system tray UI.
